results.title: The Adventures of Priscilla, Queen of the Desert
results.creator_credit: Latent Image, Specific Films, Al Clark, Michael Hamlyn and Stephan Elliott
results.brief_description: When drag queen Anthony (Hugo Weaving) takes his act on the road with fellow cross-dresser Adam (Guy Pearce) and transsexual Bernadette (Terence Stamp). In their colorful bus, Priscilla, the three performers travel across the Australian desert performing for enthusiastic crowds and homophobic locals.

constellations_primary.name: Joy of drag
constellations_primary.description: The Adventures of Priscilla, Queen of the Desert is a groundbreaking Australian film with a small budget and big impact that's taken queer Australian stories to the world.

constellations_other.name: Gender bending larrikins
constellations_other.description: Australia has a long history with gender creativity and drag culture, both on screen and on stage.

constellations_other.name: Dance sequins
constellations_other.description: Looking at dance, ballroom, the Glitter Trilogy and the Red Curtain Trilogy.

constellations_other.name: Landscape as Character
constellations_other.description: The landscape is often a character in Australian films. Usually, it's a villain that represents our problematic national character and is increasingly used to challenge our troubled history and explore our evolving identities.

recommendations.quote: The film's three leads have all swapped fabulous frocks for villainous outfits in superhero films. Terrance Stamp was Zod in Superman 2, Hugo Weaving was Red Skull in Captain America: The First Avenger and Guy Pearce was Aldrich Killian in Iron Man 3.

results.title_for_label: The Adventures of Priscilla, Queen of the Desert
results.creator_credit_for_label: Latent Image, Specific Films, Al Clark, Michael Hamlyn and Stephan Elliott
results.description:
This incredibly successful Australian comedy traces the adventures of three Sydney drag queens who travel through the Australian outback in order to perform their exuberant act in Alice Springs.

On their journey through the desert, on a bus christened Priscilla, they encounter both friendship and enmity from the small bush communities. Guy Pearce is excellent as the youngest drag queen who has a tough mouth but a lot to learn about the world, while Hugo Weaving is moving as a man who must reveal the truth of his homosexuality to his son. Terence Stamp is unforgettable as the transgendered Bernice and the loving relationship that develops between Stamp and Bill Hunter’s outback “bloke” is very tender and touching.

Full of humour, colour and bizarre costumes for which the film won an Academy Award, Priscilla is a wickedly entrancing family movie which shows that not only Australian cities but the mythical Australian bush has been affected and changed by ethnic and sexual multiculturalism. The soundtrack is full of great drag disco classics from ‘I Will Survive’ and ‘Go West’ to the more recent ‘Finally’ and ‘Save the Best for Last’.
description_for_label:

Terence Stamp is unforgettable as the transgendered Bernice and the loving relationship that develops between Stamp and Bill Hunter’s outback “bloke” is very tender and touching.

Full of humour, colour and bizarre costumes for which the film won an Academy Award, Priscilla is a wickedly entrancing family movie which shows that not only Australian cities but the mythical Australian bush has been affected and changed by ethnic and sexual multiculturalism. results.title: The Adventures of Prince Achmed = Die abenteur des Prinzen Achmed
results.brief_description: Often hailed as the first full-length animation film in the history of cinema, this is also pioneering animator Lotte Reiniger’s most extraordinary work. Reiniger developed a highly sophisticated silhouette animation technique inspired by Chinese shadow theatre. Intricate hand-cut silhouettes were combined with shimmering backgrounds created with wax and sand set on back lit glass. Colour-tinting further enhanced the luminous effect. Amongst her collaborators were her husband Carl Koch, who acted as her production manager and photographer, and the filmmakers Walter Ruttman (Berlin, Symphony of a City) and Berthold Bartosch (L’idee) who created backgrounds and special effects. The story from the Arabian Nights allows full rein for Reiniger’s elaborate and ingenious work - magical-flying horse, wicked sorcerer, djinns, ogres, monsters and wondrous kingdoms abound. This version has been restored with a new recording of the original orchestral score. Intertitles with English subtitles.

results.title: The Adventures of Pinocchio
results.creator_credit: Allied Pinocchio Prod, Davis Film and Video Production, Dieter Gessler Filmproduktions, Raju Patel, Jeffrey Sneller and Steve Barron
results.brief_description: This classic Italian story about Gepetto the carpenter who makes a wooden boy which he can love as a son. This production has wonderful computer animated special effects as the wooden “boy” becomes flesh. For those who loved the award winning Disney production, this version of the age-old story will delight all the family. Starring Martin Landau and Jonathan Taylor Thomas.

results.title: The Adventures of Peer Gynt
results.brief_description: A delightful puppet production based on the story by Ibsen and with music by Grieg. Peer Gynt enters a world filled with Trolls, Witches, Whirling Dervishes and the powerful Mountain King in the search for adventure and to get away from his nagging mother. Jim Gamble, master puppeteer introduces the story to a group of young children and then sweeps them away into a far-away fantasy land. However, things are not always what they seem.

results.title: The Adventures of Milo and Otis (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Fuji Television Network, Columbia Pictures, Masaru Kakutani, Satoru Ogata and Masanori Hata
results.brief_description: Join a curious kitten named Milo and his inseparable buddy, a pug-nosed pup named Otis, as they fall, frolic, glide and tumble through one exciting escapade after another. Narrated by Dudley Moore. Based on an original story by Masanori Hata.

results.title: The Adventures of Marco Polo
results.creator_credit: Samuel Goldwyn Productions, Samuel Goldwyn and Archie Mayo
results.brief_description: Gary Cooper stars as 13th Century explorer and adventurer Marco Polo, the Venetian who opened the trade route from Europe to China. At the court of the great Kublai Khan, ruler of the Mongol Empire, Marco battles the intrigue of the court to win the admiration of the great Khan and the love of a beautiful Princess (Sigrid Guthrie). A classic historical drama filled with spectacular battle scenes, panoramas, opulent sets and costumes. Co-starring Basil Rathbone.

results.title: The Adventures of Huck Finn
results.creator_credit: Walt Disney Pictures, Laurence Mark and Stephen Sommers
results.brief_description: Film adaptation of the classic 19th century novel ‘The Adventures of Huckleberry Finn’ by American writer, Mark Twain. This is a story about Huck Finn (Elijah Wood), a poor uneducated boy who has run away from home to escape his abusive drunken father, and Huck’s chance encounter with Jim (Courtney S. Vance), an escaped slave. Together the two follow the Mississippi River finding adventure and drama and some rather dubious characters by the names of the King (Jason Robards) and the Duke (Robbie Coltrane). Cast also includes Ron Perlman and Laura Bundy.

results.title: The Adventures of Handyman
results.creator_credit: AFTRS, Craig Salvin and Martin Murphy
results.brief_description: A suburban damsel in distress with a blocked sink heralds the arrival of Handyman - mild mannered and silver haired Reg O’Grady who proves that super heroes don’t have a shelf life.

results.title: The Adventures of Floss the Fairy and Riddley Robot: the letter Z runs away
results.brief_description: Written and produced by an Early Childhood teacher in Queensland, this tape is aimed at assisting young children in developing literacy and numeracy skills. The video is interactive, allowing young children to discover and learn through literacy and numeracy experiences, and the fantasy story encompasses songs that are supported by 3D visual effects, thus creating a fun learning environment that further develops confidence and success. Areas covered include; spatial and positional word vocabulary and relationships, numbers, the alphabet, fine motor movements, self esteem, music and movement. ‘The Adventures of Floss the Fairy and Riddley Robot’ will entertain and educate children aged 7 months to 7 years.

results.title: The Adventures of Elmo in grouchland
results.brief_description: In his first full length feature film, Elmo learns the value of sharing and friendship, with a little help from the Sesame Street gang. When his best friend - a blue blanket, is blown into Grouchland, Elmo sees no choice but to go down and rescue it himself. Arriving in Grouchland, he finds his blanket has been stolen by the evil Huxley (Mandy Patinkin). He sets out on a mission to rescue his blanket, while Big Bird, Oscar and the rest of the Sesame Street gang try to rescue their little red friend.
